Below is the pinescript.



import TradingView/ta/5


source = hl2

length = 50


show_SR = input.bool(title='Draw Support, Mean and Resistance Zones', defval=true)
draw_targets = input.bool(title='Draw Target Labels', defval=false)
draw_sl = input.bool(title='Draw Stoploss Labels', defval=false) 
sl_pct = input.float(title='Stoploss Percentage', defval=15.0)
sl_pct_formatted = 1+(sl_pct / 100)

innermult = 2
outermult = 3

var pi = 2 * math.asin(1)
var mult = pi * innermult
var mult2 = pi * outermult
var gradsize = 0.5


SAK_smoothing(_type, _src, _length) =>
    c0 = 1.0
    c1 = 0.0
    b0 = 1.0
    b1 = 0.0
    b2 = 0.0
    a1 = 0.0
    a2 = 0.0
    alpha = 0.0
    beta = 0.0
    gamma = 0.0
    cycle = 2 * pi / _length

    alpha   := 1 / _length
    b0      := alpha
    a1      := 1 - alpha

    _Input = _src
    _Output = 0.0
    _Output := c0 * (b0 * _Input + b1 * nz(_Input[1]) + b2 * nz(_Input[2])) + a1 * nz(_Output[1]) + a2 * nz(_Output[2]) - c1 * nz(_Input[_length])
    _Output

supersmoother(_src, _length) =>
    s_a1 = math.exp(-math.sqrt(2) * pi / _length)
    s_b1 = 2 * s_a1 * math.cos(math.sqrt(2) * pi / _length)
    s_c3 = -math.pow(s_a1, 2)
    s_c2 = s_b1
    s_c1 = 1 - s_c2 - s_c3
    ss = 0.0
    ss := s_c1 * _src + s_c2 * nz(ss[1], _src[1]) + s_c3 * nz(ss[2], _src[2])
    ss

//-----------------------
// Mean Reversion Channel Function
//-----------------------
get_mrc() =>
    v_condition = 0
    v_meanline = source
    v_meanrange = supersmoother(ta.tr, length)

    v_meanline := SAK_smoothing('RMA', source, length)

    v_upband1 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult
    v_loband1 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult
    v_upband2 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult2
    v_loband2 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult2

    //-- Check Condition
    if close > v_meanline
        v_upband2_1 = v_upband2 + v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_upband2_9 = v_upband2 + v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if high >= v_upband2_9 and high < v_upband2
            v_condition := 1
            v_condition
        else if high >= v_upband2 and high < v_upband2_1
            v_condition := 2
            v_condition
        else if high >= v_upband2_1
            v_condition := 3
            v_condition
        else if close <= v_meanline + v_meanrange
            v_condition := 4
            v_condition
        else
            v_condition := 5
            v_condition

    if close < v_meanline
        v_loband2_1 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_loband2_9 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if low <= v_loband2_9 and low > v_loband2
            v_condition := -1
            v_condition
        else if low <= v_loband2 and low > v_loband2_1
            v_condition := -2
            v_condition
        else if low <= v_loband2_1
            v_condition := -3
            v_condition
        else if close >= v_meanline + v_meanrange
            v_condition := -4
            v_condition
        else
            v_condition := -5
            v_condition

    [v_meanline, v_meanrange, v_upband1, v_loband1, v_upband2, v_loband2, v_condition]


[meanline, meanrange, upband1, loband1, upband2, loband2, condition] = get_mrc()

//************************************************************************************************************
// Trade Signals
//************************************************************************************************************
candle_color = close>open?#089981:#f23645
if close > upband2
    candle_color := color.blue
barcolor(candle_color)



var state = 'idle'
var sl_price = 0.0

// SHORT ENTRY
if close[1] > upband1[1] and close < upband1 and close < open//(close - open != 0.0)// Short Signal
    label.new(bar_index,high,'Short',color=color.purple, textcolor = color.white,yloc = yloc.abovebar, style = label.style_label_down, size=size.small)
    state := 'Position'
    sl_price := close * sl_pct_formatted

if close > sl_price and state != 'idle'

    if draw_sl
        if state == 'Position'
            label.new(bar_index,high,'Hard SL',color=color.rgb(177, 130, 0), textcolor = color.white,yloc = yloc.abovebar, style = label.style_label_down, size=size.small)
        if state == 'Target 1'
            label.new(bar_index,high,'Soft SL',color=color.rgb(245, 230, 20), textcolor = color.black,yloc = yloc.abovebar, style = label.style_label_down, size=size.small)

    state := 'idle'
// SHORT TARGETS
if draw_targets
    if state == 'Position' and (close <= meanline) //and close < position_price
        label.new(bar_index,high,'T1',color=color.rgb(16, 156, 199), textcolor = color.white,yloc = yloc.abovebar, style = label.style_label_down, size=size.small)
        state := 'Target 1'

    if state == 'Target 1' and (close <= loband1) //and close < position_price
        label.new(bar_index,high,'T2',color=color.rgb(16, 156, 199), textcolor = color.white,yloc = yloc.abovebar, style = label.style_label_down, size=size.small)
        state := 'idle'




//************************************************************************************************************
// Plots
//************************************************************************************************************
box resistance_box = na
box median_box = na
box support_box = na

if barstate.islast and show_SR
    
    res_top_left = chart.point.new(time[10], bar_index[10], upband2)
    res_bottom_right = chart.point.new(time+30, bar_index+30, upband1)
    resistance_box := box.new(res_top_left, res_bottom_right, border_width = 1, bgcolor = color.rgb(255, 9, 9, 86), border_color = color.rgb(255, 58, 58, 42), extend = extend.right)

    // Median 
    full_range = math.abs(upband1 - loband1)
    median_spread = full_range / 15

    med_top_left = chart.point.new(time[10], bar_index[10], meanline+median_spread)
    med_bottom_right = chart.point.new(time+30, bar_index+30, meanline-median_spread)
    median_box := box.new(med_top_left, med_bottom_right, border_width = 1, bgcolor = color.rgb(9, 95, 255, 86), border_color = color.rgb(58, 110, 255, 42), extend = extend.right)

    sup_top_left = chart.point.new(time[10], bar_index[10], loband2)
    sup_bottom_right = chart.point.new(time+30, bar_index+30, loband1)
    support_box := box.new(sup_top_left, sup_bottom_right, border_width = 1, bgcolor = color.rgb(9, 255, 29, 86), border_color = color.rgb(15, 214, 41, 42), extend = extend.right)


    box.delete(resistance_box[1])
    box.delete(median_box[1])
    box.delete(support_box[1])

Here is a Python script that corresponds to the given TradingView Pine Script:

```python
import math
import numpy as np

def SAK_smoothing(_type, _src, _length):
    c0 = 1.0
    c1 = 0.0
    b0 = 1.0
    b1 = 0.0
    b2 = 0.0
    a1 = 0.0
    a2 = 0.0
    alpha = 0.0
    beta = 0.0
    gamma = 0.0
    cycle = 2 * np.pi / _length

    alpha = 1 / _length
    b0 = alpha
    a1 = 1 - alpha

    _Input = _src
    _Output = np.zeros(len(_src))
    for i in range(len(_src)):
        _Output[i] = c0 * (b0 * _Input[i] + b1 * np.nan_to_num(_Input[i-1]) + b2 * np.nan_to_num(_Input[i-2])) + a1 * np.nan_to_num(_Output[i-1]) + a2 * np.nan_to_num(_Output[i-2]) - c1 * np.nan_to_num(_Input[i - _length])
    return _Output

def supersmoother(_src, _length):
    s_a1 = np.exp(-np.sqrt(2) * np.pi / _length)
    s_b1 = 2 * s_a1 * np.cos(np.sqrt(2) * np.pi / _length)
    s_c3 = -np.power(s_a1, 2)
    s_c2 = s_b1
    s_c1 = 1 - s_c2 - s_c3
    ss = np.zeros(len(_src))
    for i in range(len(_src)):
        ss[i] = s_c1 * _src[i] + s_c2 * np.nan_to_num(ss[i-1], _src[i-1]) + s_c3 * np.nan_to_num(ss[i-2], _src[i-2])
    return ss

def get_mrc():
    v_condition = 0
    v_meanline = source
    v_meanrange = supersmoother(ta.tr, length)

    v_meanline = SAK_smoothing('RMA', source, length)

    v_upband1 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult
    v_loband1 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult
    v_upband2 = v_meanline + v_meanrange * mult2
    v_loband2 = v_meanline - v_meanrange * mult2

    if close > v_meanline:
        v_upband2_1 = v_upband2 + v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_upband2_9 = v_upband2 + v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if high >= v_upband2_9 and high < v_upband2:
            v_condition = 1
        elif high >= v_upband2 and high < v_upband2_1:
            v_condition = 2
        elif high >= v_upband2_1:
            v_condition = 3
        elif close <= v_meanline + v_meanrange:
            v_condition = 4
        else:
            v_condition = 5

    if close < v_meanline:
        v_loband2_1 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * 4
        v_loband2_9 = v_loband2 - v_meanrange * gradsize * -4
        if low <= v_loband2_9 and low > v_loband2:
            v_condition = -1
        elif low <= v_loband2 and low > v_loband2_1:
            v_condition = -2
        elif low <= v_loband2_1:
```

CODEMASTER:

Based on your description, it seems like you have already implemented the code to connect the submit button to the `submit_button_clicked` function. The line `submit_button.clicked.connect(submit_button_clicked)` connects the clicked signal from the submit button to the `submit_button_clicked` function.

However, it seems as though this code is not indented correctly. All the code after the comment "# Connect the submit button to the submit_button_clicked function" should be indented one level to be included inside the `__init__` method of the `AppUI` class.

Here's how the corrected code should look like:

```
class AppUI(QDialog):
    def __init__(self, driver):
        QDialog.__init__(self)
        
        # Set up the UI layout
        vbox = QVBoxLayout()
        self.setLayout(vbox)

        # Add username input field to the UI layout
        self.username_label = QLabel('Username:')
        self.username_input = QLineEdit()
        vbox.addWidget(self.username_label, alignment=Qt.AlignCenter)
        vbox.addWidget(self.username_input, alignment=Qt.AlignCenter)

        # Add password input field to the UI layout
        self.password_label = QLabel('Password:')
        self.password_input = QLineEdit()
        self.password_input.setEchoMode(QLineEdit.Password)
        vbox.addWidget(self.password_label, alignment=Qt.AlignCenter)
        vbox.addWidget(self.password_input, alignment=Qt.AlignCenter)

        # Add a submit button to the UI layout
        submit_button = QPushButton('Submit')
        
        def submit_button_clicked():
            # Create a new instance of the MetrcSalesPage class
            sales_page = MetrcSalesPage(driver)

            # Call the load_config method to load selectors from the config file
            sales_page.load_config()

            # Call other necessary methods on the sales_page object to perform actions on the web page
            sales_page.navigate_to_sales_page()
            sales_page.set_items_per_page()
            sales_page.highlight_items()
            sales_page.get_completed_sales_count()
            sales_page.finalize_selected_packages()
            sales_page.finalize_sales()

            # Optionally, display a message box or send a notification email when the button is clicked
            pymsgbox.alert('All Sales Have Been Pushed To The State', 'Message Box Title')
            send_notification_email('All sales have been pushed to the state', 'Notification Subject')

        # Connect the submit button to the submit_button_clicked function
        submit_button.clicked.connect(submit_button_clicked)

        # Add the submit button to the UI layout
        vbox.addWidget(submit_button, alignment=Qt.AlignCenter)
```

Note that you will need to import the necessary modules and define the `MetrcSalesPage` class in your code for this to work properly.

conversation.content: Classify below text
It seems you haven't provided the text you want to be classified. Please provide the text so I can analyze it and classify it for you.
Alert monitoring

Based on the term "alert monitoring," we can classify this topic under the following categories:

1. **IT and Cybersecurity**: In the context of IT, alert monitoring refers to the process of continuously reviewing and responding to alerts generated by cybersecurity systems, network monitoring tools, or incident detection software to protect digital assets. It includes the identification, assessment, and prioritization of potential threats and issues.

2. **Healthcare**: In healthcare, alert monitoring could relate to the use of medical devices and systems to supervise patient health indicators continuously. It involves tracking vital signs or other health parameters to quickly identify and respond to any signs of deterioration or medical emergencies.

3. **Operations and Process Control**: In industrial or operational contexts, alert monitoring might relate to supervising systems or processes to ensure optimal performance, safety, and compliance. It involves tracking anomalies, failures, or deviations from expected performance metrics in real-time to prevent accidents, inefficiencies, or breakdowns.

4. **Environmental Monitoring**: Refers to the surveillance of environmental parameters (such as air quality, water quality, or radiation levels) to detect deviations that could indicate pollution incidents or hazardous conditions, triggering immediate action to mitigate risks.

Each of these categories highlights how alert monitoring plays a crucial role in proactively identifying and responding to potential issues across various domains.

conversation.content: how can I get the name of application output when I use logcat?

To get the name of the application output when using logcat, you can add a filter for the specific application by using the following command in the terminal:

```
adb logcat -s <application-name>
```

Replace `<application-name>` with the name of the application you want to filter. This will only show the log messages related to that application in the output.
would you please give me an instence?

Sure, here is an example:

Let's say you want to get the name of the application output for the Twitter app. You can use the following command:

```
adb logcat -s Twitter
```

This will only show the log messages related to the Twitter app in the output. You can replace "Twitter" with the name of any other application you want to filter.
would you please give me an instence?  the sentence is grammarlly correct?

I am trying to delete characters from the first column of the csv file.

Got it! To remove characters from the first column of a CSV file using a script, you can follow these steps:

1. Read the CSV file: Use a library like `csv` or `pandas` to read the CSV file and load it into your script.

Here's an example using the `csv` library:

```python
import csv

# Open the CSV file
with open('your_file.csv', 'r') as file:

    # Read the CSV file
    reader = csv.reader(file)

    # Loop through each row and modify the first column
    for row in reader:
        # Remove characters from the first column
        row[0] = row[0].replace('characters_to_remove', '')

        # Process the modified row
        # ...
```

Replace `your_file.csv` with the actual path or name of your CSV file, and `characters_to_remove` with the specific characters you want to delete from the first column.

2. Modify the first column: Access the first column of each row (index 0 in most cases) and use the `replace()` method to remove the specified characters.

Make sure to replace `characters_to_remove` with the actual characters you want to delete.

3. Process the modified row: You can perform any other actions or modifications you need to do with the row/column or even write the modified data to a new CSV file using the same library.

Remember to adapt the script to your specific needs and make sure you have the necessary dependencies installed (such as `csv` or `pandas`).

Let me know if you need further assistance or have any other questions!
I want do delete all the letters but leave the integers from the first file is this possible?

Certainly! To delete all the letters and keep only the integers from the first column of a CSV file, you can use regular expressions to match and replace the characters.

Here's an example using the `csv` library and regular expressions in Python:

```python
import csv
import re

# Open the CSV file
with open('your_file.csv', 'r') as file:

    # Read the CSV file
    reader = csv.reader(file)

    # Loop through each row and modify the first column
    for row in reader:
        # Remove letters from the first column
        row[0] = re.sub(r'[^0-9]+', '', row[0])

        # Process the modified row
        # ...
```

Replace `your_file.csv` with the actual path or name of your CSV file.

In this example, the `re.sub()` function is used with the regular expression pattern `[^0-9]+` to match any character that is not a digit (0-9) and replace them with an empty string. The result will be a string containing only the integers.

Note that this approach assumes that the first column of your CSV file contains only alphanumeric characters. If there are other special characters, you may need to adjust the regular expression pattern accordingly.

Make sure to import the necessary modules (`csv` and `re`) before using them.

Feel free to adapt this code to your specific requirements. Let me know if you have any further questions!
can you write this script so I can Copy and paste in to Visual studio?

Certainly! Here's a script that you can copy and paste into Visual Studio for removing letters and keeping only integers from the first column of a CSV file:

```python
import csv
import re

def remove_letters_from_csv(file_path):
    # Open the CSV file
    with open(file_path, 'r') as file:

        # Read the CSV file
        reader = csv.reader(file)

        # Create a list to store modified rows
        modified_rows = []

        # Loop through each row and modify the first column
        for row in reader:
            # Remove letters from the first column
            row[0] = re.sub(r'[^0-9]+', '', row[0])

            # Append the modified row to the list
            modified_rows.append(row)

    # Write the modified rows to a new CSV file
    output_file = 'modified_file.csv'
    with open(output_file, 'w', newline='') as file:
        writer = csv.writer(file)
        writer.writerows(modified_rows)

    print(f"Successfully modified the CSV file. Modified data saved to {output_file}.")

# Provide the file path of your CSV file
file_path = 'your_file.csv'

# Call the function to remove letters from the CSV file
remove_letters_from_csv(file_path)
```

Replace `'your_file.csv'` in the `file_path` variable with the actual path or name of your input CSV file.

After running the script, it will create a new CSV file called `modified_file.csv`, which will contain the modified data with letters removed from the first column.

Make sure you have the necessary packages (`csv` and `re`) installed in your Python environment.

I need an excel formula to find a specific price of different products based on the latest date.

To find the specific price of different products based on the latest date, you can use a combination of the INDEX and MATCH functions in Excel. Here's how you can do it:

Assuming you have the following data in your Excel worksheet:

- Column A contains the product names
- Column B contains the prices
- Column C contains the dates

You can use the following formula to retrieve the price of a specific product based on the latest date:

=INDEX(B:B, MATCH(MAX(IF(A:A="Product Name", C:C)), C:C, 0))

Replace "Product Name" in the formula with the actual product name you are looking for.

which one is more accurate index match or vlookup?

Both INDEX MATCH and VLOOKUP are powerful functions in Excel, but each has its own strengths and limitations. The choice between the two depends on the specific scenario and what you are trying to achieve.

VLOOKUP is simpler and more commonly used, especially for basic lookups. It only searches for a value in the leftmost column of a range and retrieves a corresponding value from the same row in a specified column. However, it has some limitations, such as the inability to look up values to the left of the search column, and it requires the lookup column to be sorted in ascending order.

INDEX MATCH, on the other hand, is more versatile and robust. It allows you to search for a value in any column of a range and retrieve a corresponding value from a different column in the same row. INDEX returns the value at a given row and column in a specified range, while MATCH provides the relative position of a lookup value within a specified range.

Overall, INDEX MATCH is usually preferred because it offers greater flexibility and can handle a wider range of lookup scenarios. It is also not affected by the sorting order of the data. However, if you are dealing with simple lookups and have already sorted data, VLOOKUP can be a simpler and faster option.

conversation.content: how do I write a function in excel that tells me if a given value in another column shows up more than once in the same sheet

You can write a function in Excel using a combination of formulas like COUNTIF and IF. Here's an example function that checks if a given value in column A shows up more than once in the same sheet:

=IF(COUNTIF(A:A, A1)>1, "More than once", "Only once")

Here's how the function works:

1. COUNTIF(A:A, A1) counts how many times the value in cell A1 appears in column A.
2. If the count is greater than 1 (meaning it appears more than once), the function returns "More than once".
3. If the count is 1 (meaning it appears only once), the function returns "Only once".

how do i establish a SQL connection in python?

To establish a SQL connection in Python, you can use the `pyodbc` library. Here's an example of how you can establish a SQL connection in Python:

```python
import pyodbc

# Define connection parameters
server = 'your_server'
database = 'your_database'
username = 'your_username'
password = 'your_password'
driver = 'SQL Server'  # Adjust the driver based on your SQL server type

# Create the connection string
conn_str = f"DRIVER={{{driver}}};SERVER={server};DATABASE={database};UID={username};PWD={password}"

# Establish the SQL connection
conn = pyodbc.connect(conn_str)

# Create a cursor object to execute queries
cursor = conn.cursor()

# Perform SQL queries using the cursor object

# Close the cursor and connection when done
cursor.close()
conn.close()
```

Make sure you provide the correct values for `server`, `database`, `username`, `password`, and `driver` based on your SQL server configuration. You may need to install the `pyodbc` package using `pip` if it's not already installed.

Once the connection is established, you can use the `cursor` object to execute SQL queries and retrieve the results. Remember to close the cursor and connection when you're finished to free up system resources.
is there a way to connect without a username or password?

Yes, it is possible to establish a SQL connection without a username or password, depending on your SQL server configuration. Here are a couple of scenarios:

1. Windows Authentication (Integrated Security):
If your SQL server is configured to use Windows Authentication, you can connect without providing a specific username or password. In this case, you can modify the connection string by removing the `UID` and `PWD` parameters. Here's an example:

```python
import pyodbc

server = 'your_server'
database = 'your_database'
driver = 'SQL Server'

conn_str = f"DRIVER={{{driver}}};SERVER={server};DATABASE={database};Trusted_Connection=yes"

conn = pyodbc.connect(conn_str)
cursor = conn.cursor()

# Perform SQL queries using the cursor object

cursor.close()
conn.close()
```

By setting `Trusted_Connection` to "yes," the connection will use the Windows credentials of the user running the Python script.

2. Trusted Connection (without username or password):
If your SQL server is configured to allow trusted connections without requiring a username or password, you can modify the connection string to include the `Trusted_Connection=yes` parameter. Here's an example:

```python
import pyodbc

driver = 'SQL Server'

conn.close()
```

Make sure to adjust the `server`, `database`, and `driver` parameters based on your SQL server configuration.

Note that the ability to connect without a username or password depends on your SQL server settings and security policies.
write a ROW_number function in sql where I am counting the instances of orders per customer that exclude orders equal to 2 and 5

To write a SQL function using ROW_NUMBER that counts the instances of orders per customer, excluding orders equal to 2 and 5, you can use a subquery or a common table expression (CTE). Here's an example:

Using subquery:
```sql
SELECT 
    customer_id, 
    order_id, 
    ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY customer_id ORDER BY order_id) AS order_count
FROM 
    orders
WHERE
    order_id NOT IN (2, 5)
```

Using CTE:
```sql
WITH cte AS (
    SELECT 
        customer_id, 
        order_id, 
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY customer_id ORDER BY order_id) AS order_count
    FROM 
        orders
    WHERE
        order_id NOT IN (2, 5)
)
SELECT 
    customer_id, 
    order_id, 
    order_count
FROM 
    cte
```

In both cases, this query retrieves the customer ID, order ID, and the row number representing the order count for each customer. The `PARTITION BY` clause in the `OVER` clause ensures that the ROW_NUMBER function counts the instances of orders per customer. The `ORDER BY` clause defines the order in which the rows are assigned the row numbers.

The `WHERE` clause is used to exclude orders with order ID 2 and 5 from the counting process. Adjust the table name, column names, and the criteria in the `WHERE` clause based on your specific database structure.
when should I use CTE over subqueries and vice versa? Please provide example queries using the same example dataset for the explanation

Both Common Table Expressions (CTEs) and subqueries are powerful tools for performing complex queries in SQL. Here are some considerations for when to use CTEs or subqueries and examples using the same dataset:

Use CTEs when:
1. To improve query readability: CTEs can enhance code legibility by breaking down complex queries into more manageable, self-contained sections.

Example:
```sql
WITH customer_orders AS (
    SELECT 
        customer_id,
        COUNT(order_id) AS total_orders
    FROM 
        orders
    GROUP BY
        customer_id
)
SELECT 
    customer_id,
    total_orders
FROM 
    customer_orders
WHERE 
    total_orders > 5
```

2. To reuse the same query logic multiple times: CTEs can be referenced multiple times within a single query, eliminating redundant code and improving query execution efficiency.

Example:
```sql
WITH customer_orders AS (
    SELECT 
        customer_id,
        COUNT(order_id) AS total_orders
    FROM 
        orders
    GROUP BY
        customer_id
)
SELECT 
    customer_id,
    total_orders
FROM 
    customer_orders
UNION ALL
SELECT 
    customer_id,
    total_orders
FROM 
    customer_orders
WHERE 
    total_orders > 5
```

Use subqueries when:
1. To encapsulate a query result within another query: Subqueries are useful when the result of the inner query needs to be used as a filter or parameter within the outer query.

Example:
```sql
SELECT 
    customer_id,
    (SELECT AVG(order_total) FROM orders WHERE customer_id = c.customer_id) AS avg_order_total
FROM 
    customers c
```

2. To perform calculations or make comparisons within the same query: Subqueries can be used to calculate aggregates or perform comparisons without the need to create intermediate tables.

Example:
```sql
SELECT 
    customer_id,
    order_total,
    (SELECT AVG(order_total) FROM orders) AS avg_order_total
FROM 
    orders
```

Remember, the choice of using CTEs or subqueries depends on query complexity, readability, code reusability, and optimization requirements. It's important to evaluate the specific needs of your query and select the appropriate approach.
how do each affect memory and performance when it comes to producing larger datasets?

Both CTEs and subqueries can have implications for memory usage and query performance when dealing with larger datasets. Here's a brief overview of how each may affect memory and performance:

CTEs:
- Memory Usage: CTEs can consume additional memory, especially when used recursively or with multiple levels of nesting. Each CTE creates a temporary result set that is stored in memory for the duration of the query.
- Performance: CTEs can offer better performance in certain scenarios, as the query optimizer may be able to optimize the execution plan more effectively. However, if not used optimally or with large data volumes, CTEs can have a negative impact on performance.

Subqueries:
- Memory Usage: Subqueries generally have a smaller memory footprint as they don't create temporary result sets. However, memory usage can increase if subqueries are deeply nested or involve complex calculations.
- Performance: Subqueries can sometimes result in slower performance compared to CTEs, especially when used within predicates or in a correlated manner. Subqueries can lead to repetitive computations, which can be inefficient for large datasets.

When dealing with larger datasets, it's important to consider the following tips to optimize memory usage and performance:
- Limit the number of rows and columns returned by queries using appropriate filters.
- Optimize indexing on frequently joined or filtered columns.
- Use appropriate joins and consider using techniques like EXISTS or NOT EXISTS instead of subqueries when possible.
- Analyze query execution plans and monitor query performance using tools provided by your database management system.

Ultimately, the impact on memory and performance will depend on the complexity of your queries, the size of your data, and the specific optimization techniques employed. It's always recommended to test and benchmark different approaches with your specific dataset to identify the most efficient solution.

```sql
SELECT 
    customer_id, 
    COUNT(*) AS order_count
FROM

GROUP BY
```

Adjust the table name, column names, and the criteria in the WHERE clause based on your specific database structure.
How do i write two dataframes to the same excel file without overwriting the previous dataframe?

To write two dataframes to the same Excel file without overwriting the previous dataframe, you can utilize the `pandas.ExcelWriter` class from the pandas library. Here's an example of how you can achieve this:

```python
import pandas as pd

# Create an ExcelWriter object for the output file
with pd.ExcelWriter('output_file.xlsx', engine='xlsxwriter') as writer:
    # Write the first dataframe to a sheet named 'Sheet1'
    dataframe1.to_excel(writer, sheet_name='Sheet1', index=False)
    
    # Write the second dataframe to a sheet named 'Sheet2'
    dataframe2.to_excel(writer, sheet_name='Sheet2', index=False)
    
    # Optionally, you can also add more dataframes to additional sheets if needed
    # dataframe3.to_excel(writer, sheet_name='Sheet3', index=False)
    
    # Save the changes and close the ExcelWriter object
    writer.save()
```

In this example, the `pd.ExcelWriter('output_file.xlsx', engine='xlsxwriter')` line creates an ExcelWriter object, specifying the output file name and the Excel writer engine.

The `dataframe1.to_excel(writer, sheet_name='Sheet1', index=False)` line writes the first dataframe (dataframe1) to a sheet named 'Sheet1' within the Excel file.

Similarly, the `dataframe2.to_excel(writer, sheet_name='Sheet2', index=False)` line writes the second dataframe (dataframe2) to a sheet named 'Sheet2'.

You can continue adding more dataframes to additional sheets using similar lines of code.

Finally, the `writer.save()` line saves the changes to the Excel file and closes the ExcelWriter object.

Make sure to adjust the filenames, sheet names, and dataframe variables based on your requirements.
what happens if I don't a writer, does specifying the sheet name in teh function spar the overwriting?

If you don't use an ExcelWriter and simply call the `to_excel()` function without specifying a specific sheet name, by default, it will overwrite the existing file and create a new Excel file with only the current dataframe. Each subsequent call to `to_excel()` without an ExcelWriter will overwrite the previous file.

To prevent overwriting the file and write multiple dataframes to the same file without using an ExcelWriter, you can utilize pandas' `ExcelFile` class in combination with the `to_excel()` function. Here's an example:

```python
import pandas as pd

# Load the existing Excel file
excel_file = pd.ExcelFile('output_file.xlsx')

# Write the first dataframe to the existing Excel file and specify a sheet name
dataframe1.to_excel(excel_file, sheet_name='Sheet1', index=False)

# Write the second dataframe to the same Excel file and specify a sheet name
dataframe2.to_excel(excel_file, sheet_name='Sheet2', index=False)

# Save the changes to the Excel file
excel_file.save()
```

In this code, the `pd.ExcelFile('output_file.xlsx')` line creates an ExcelFile object, which loads the existing Excel file into memory.

Then, the `dataframe1.to_excel(excel_file, sheet_name='Sheet1', index=False)` line writes the first dataframe (dataframe1) to the specified sheet name ('Sheet1') within the existing Excel file.

Similarly, the `dataframe2.to_excel(excel_file, sheet_name='Sheet2', index=False)` line writes the second dataframe (dataframe2) to the specified sheet name ('Sheet2') within the same file.

Finally, the `excel_file.save()` line saves the changes to the existing Excel file.

By following this approach, you can avoid overwriting the existing file and write multiple dataframes to different sheets within the same Excel file.

import pandas as pd

```
import tia.bbg.datamgr as dm

# Set the file path (replace with your own file path)
monthly_data_path = 'Y:\XL_Data\INV GRADE TEAM\Monthly Commentary\Monthly Data Tracker.xlsx'

# Define the Bloomberg tickers you want to retrieve
tickers = ['LUACYW Index', 'LUACOAS Index', 'MOVE Index']

# Retrieve the Bloomberg data using 'tia'
mgr = dm.BbgDataManager()
response = mgr[tickers].get_data(fields, startdate=df1['Date'].min(), enddate=df1['Date'].max())

```

Finally, the existing 'df1' dataframe is merged with the 'new_data' dataframe using the 'Date' column as the common key. You can then do something with the merged data as required. '''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''
' Overview
'

Option Explicit

Public Enum calDayOfWeek
    Sunday = 1
    Monday = 2
    Tuesday = 3
    Wednesday = 4
    Thursday = 5
    Friday = 6
    Saturday = 7
End Enum

Public Enum calFirstWeekOfYear      'Controls how the week numbers are calculated and displayed
    FirstJan1 = 1                   'The week with January 1st is always counted as week 1
    FirstFourDays = 2               'The first week in January that has at least four days in it is
                                        'counted as week 1. This calculation will change depending
                                        'on the setting used for first day of the week. The ISO
                                        'standard is calculating week 1 as the first week in January
                                        'with four days with Monday being the first day of the week.
    FirstFullWeek = 3               'The first week in January with a full week is counted as week 1.
                                        'Like the FirstFourDays setting, this calculation will change
                                        'depending on the first day of the week used.
End Enum

Private UserformEventsEnabled As Boolean    'Controls userform events
Private DateOut As Date                     'The date returned from the CalendarForm
Private SelectedDateIn As Date              'The initial selected date, as well as the date currently selected by the
                                                'user if the Okay button is enabled
Private OkayEnabled As Boolean              'Stores whether Okay button is enabled
Private TodayEnabled As Boolean             'Stores whether Today button is enabled
Private MinDate As Date                     'Minimum date set by user
Private MaxDate As Date                     'Maximum date set by user
Private cmbYearMin As Long                  'Current lower bounds of year combobox. Not necessarily restricted to this min
Private cmbYearMax As Long                  'Current upper bounds of year combobox. Not necessarily restricted to this max
Private StartWeek As VbDayOfWeek            'First day of week in calendar
Private WeekOneOfYear As VbFirstWeekOfYear  'First week of year when setting week numbers
Private HoverControlName As String          'Name of the date label that is currently being hovered over. Used when returning
                                                'the hovered control to its original color
Private HoverControlColor As Long           'Original color of the date label that is currently being hovered over
Private RatioToResize As Double             'Ratio to resize elements of userform. This is set by the DateFontSize argument
                                                'in the GetDate function
Private bgDateColor As Long                 'Color of date label backgrounds
Private bgDateHoverColor As Long            'Color of date label backgrounds when hovering over
Private bgDateSelectedColor As Long         'Color of selected date label background
Private lblDateColor As Long                'Font color of date labels
Private lblDatePrevMonthColor As Long       'Font color of trailing month date labels
Private lblDateTodayColor As Long           'Font color of today's date
Private lblDateSatColor As Long             'Font color of Saturday date labels
Private lblDateSunColor As Long             'Font color of Sunday date labels

Public Function GetDate(Optional SelectedDate As Date = 0, _
    Optional FirstDayOfWeek As calDayOfWeek = Sunday, _
    Optional MinimumDate As Date = 0, _
    Optional MaximumDate As Date = 0, _
    Optional RangeOfYears As Long = 10, _
    Optional DateFontSize As Long = 9, _
    Optional TodayButton As Boolean = False, Optional OkayButton As Boolean = False, _
    Optional ShowWeekNumbers As Boolean = False, Optional FirstWeekOfYear As calFirstWeekOfYear = FirstJan1, _
    Optional PositionTop As Long = -5, Optional PositionLeft As Long = -5, _
    Optional BackgroundColor As Long = 16777215, _
    Optional HeaderColor As Long = 15658734, _
    Optional HeaderFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional SubHeaderColor As Long = 16448250, _
    Optional SubHeaderFontColor As Long = 8553090, _
    Optional DateColor As Long = 16777215, _
    Optional DateFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional SaturdayFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional SundayFontColor As Long = 0, _
    Optional DateBorder As Boolean = False, Optional DateBorderColor As Long = 15658734, _
    Optional DateSpecialEffect As fmSpecialEffect = fmSpecialEffectFlat, _
    Optional DateHoverColor As Long = 15658734, _
    Optional DateSelectedColor As Long = 14277081, _
    Optional TrailingMonthFontColor As Long = 12566463, _
    Optional TodayFontColor As Long = 15773696) As Date
    
    'Set global variables
    DateFontSize = Max(DateFontSize, 9) 'Font size cannot be below 9
    OkayEnabled = OkayButton
    TodayEnabled = TodayButton
    RatioToResize = DateFontSize / 9
    bgDateColor = DateColor
    lblDateColor = DateFontColor
    lblDateSatColor = SaturdayFontColor
    lblDateSunColor = SundayFontColor
    bgDateHoverColor = DateHoverColor
    bgDateSelectedColor = DateSelectedColor
    lblDatePrevMonthColor = TrailingMonthFontColor
    lblDateTodayColor = TodayFontColor
    StartWeek = FirstDayOfWeek
    WeekOneOfYear = FirstWeekOfYear
    
    'Initialize userform
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    Call InitializeUserform(SelectedDate, MinimumDate, MaximumDate, RangeOfYears, PositionTop, PositionLeft, _
        DateFontSize, ShowWeekNumbers, BackgroundColor, HeaderColor, HeaderFontColor, SubHeaderColor, _
        SubHeaderFontColor, DateBorder, DateBorderColor, DateSpecialEffect)
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
    
    'Show userform, return selected date, and unload
    Me.Show
    GetDate = DateOut
    Unload Me
End Function

Private Sub InitializeUserform(SelectedDate As Date, MinimumDate As Date, MaximumDate As Date, _
    RangeOfYears As Long, _
    PositionTop As Long, PositionLeft As Long, _
    SizeFont As Long, bWeekNumbers As Boolean, _
    BackgroundColor As Long, _
    HeaderColor As Long, _
    HeaderFontColor As Long, _
    SubHeaderColor As Long, _
    SubHeaderFontColor As Long, _
    DateBorder As Boolean, DateBorderColor As Long, _
    DateSpecialEffect As fmSpecialEffect)
    
    Dim TempDate As Date                        'Used to set selected date, if none has been provided
    Dim SelectedYear As Long                    'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long                   'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long                     'Day of seledcted date (if applicable)
    Dim TempDayOfWeek As Long                   'Used to set day labels in subheader
    Dim BorderSpacing As Double                 'Padding between the outermost elements of userform and edge of userform
    Dim HeaderDefaultFontSize As Long           'Default font size of the header labels (month and year)
    Dim bgHeaderDefaultHeight As Double         'Default height of the background behind header labels
    Dim lblMonthYearDefaultHeight As Double     'Default height of the month and year header labels
    Dim scrlMonthDefaultHeight As Double        'Default height of the month scroll bar
    Dim bgDayLabelsDefaultHeight As Double      'Default height of the background behind the subheader day of week labels
    Dim bgDateDefaultHeight As Double           'Default height of the background behind each date label
    Dim bgDateDefaultWidth As Double            'Default width of the background behind each date label
    Dim lblDateDefaultHeight As Double          'Default height of each date label
    Dim cmdButtonDefaultHeight As Double        'Default height of Today and Okay command buttons
    Dim cmdButtonDefaultWidth As Double         'Default width of Today and Okay command buttons
    Dim cmdButtonsCombinedWidth As Double       'Combined width of Today and Okay buttons. Used to center on userform
    Dim cmdButtonsMaxHeight As Double           'Maximum height of command buttons and month scroll bar
    Dim cmdButtonsMaxWidth As Double            'Maximum width of command buttons
    Dim cmdButtonsMaxFontSize As Long           'Maximum font size of command buttons
    Dim bgControl As MSForms.Control            'Stores current date label background in loop to initialize various settings
    Dim lblControl As MSForms.Control           'Stores current date label in loop to initialize various settings
    Dim HeightOffset As Double                  'Difference between form height and inside height, to account for toolbar
    Dim i As Long                               'Used for loops
    Dim j As Long                               'Used for loops
    
    'Initialize default values
    BorderSpacing = 6 * RatioToResize
    HeaderDefaultFontSize = 11
    bgHeaderDefaultHeight = 30
    lblMonthYearDefaultHeight = 13.5
    scrlMonthDefaultHeight = 18
    bgDayLabelsDefaultHeight = 18
    bgDateDefaultHeight = 18
    bgDateDefaultWidth = 18
    lblDateDefaultHeight = 10.5
    cmdButtonDefaultHeight = 24
    cmdButtonDefaultWidth = 60
    cmdButtonsMaxHeight = 36
    cmdButtonsMaxWidth = 90
    cmdButtonsMaxFontSize = 14

    If MinimumDate <= 0 Then
        MinDate = CDate("1/1/1900")
    Else
        MinDate = MinimumDate
    End If
    If MaximumDate = 0 Then
        MaxDate = CDate("12/31/9999")
    Else
        MaxDate = MaximumDate
    End If
    If MaxDate < MinDate Then MaxDate = MinDate
    
    'If today's date falls outside min/max, make sure Today button is disabled
    If Date < MinDate Or Date > MaxDate Then TodayEnabled = False

    'Initialize userform position. Initial value of top and left is -5. Check
    'this value to see if a different value has been passed. If not, position
    'to CenterOwner. Must set both top and left positions to override center position
    If PositionTop <> -5 And PositionLeft <> -5 Then
        Me.StartUpPosition = 0
        Me.Top = PositionTop
        Me.Left = PositionLeft
    Else
        Me.StartUpPosition = 1
    End If
    
    With bgHeader
        .Height = bgHeaderDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        'The header width depends on whether week numbers are visible or not
        If bWeekNumbers Then
            .Width = 8 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize) + BorderSpacing
        Else
            .Width = 7 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize)
        End If
        .Left = BorderSpacing
        .Top = BorderSpacing
    End With

    With scrlMonth
        .Width = bgHeader.Width - (2 * BorderSpacing)
        .Left = bgHeader.Left + BorderSpacing
        .Height = scrlMonthDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        If .Height > cmdButtonsMaxHeight Then .Height = cmdButtonsMaxHeight
        .Top = bgHeader.Top + ((bgHeader.Height - .Height) / 2)
    End With

    With bgScrollCover
        .Height = scrlMonth.Height
        .Width = scrlMonth.Width - 25 '25 is the width of the actual scroll buttons,
                                      'which need to remain visible
        .Left = scrlMonth.Left + 12.5
        .Top = scrlMonth.Top
    End With

    With lblMonth
        .AutoSize = False
        .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
        .Top = bgScrollCover.Top + ((bgScrollCover.Height - .Height) / 2)
    End With
    With lblYear
        .AutoSize = False
        .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
        .Top = bgScrollCover.Top + ((bgScrollCover.Height - .Height) / 2)
    End With
    cmbMonth.Top = lblMonth.Top + (lblMonth.Height - cmbMonth.Height)
    cmbYear.Top = lblYear.Top + (lblYear.Height - cmbYear.Height)

    With bgDayLabels
        .Height = bgDayLabelsDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
        'The width depends on whether week numbers are visible or not
        If bWeekNumbers Then
            .Width = 8 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize) + BorderSpacing
        Else
            .Width = 7 * (bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize)
        End If
        .Left = BorderSpacing
        .Top = bgHeader.Top + bgHeader.Height
    End With
    'Week number subheader label
    If Not bWeekNumbers Then
        lblWk.Visible = False
    Else
        With lblWk
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Font.Size = SizeFont
            .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + ((bgDayLabels.Height - .Height) / 2)
            .Left = BorderSpacing
        End With
    End If
    'Day of week subheader labels
    For i = 1 To 7
        With Me("lblDay" & CStr(i))
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Font.Size = SizeFont
            .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + ((bgDayLabels.Height - .Height) / 2)
            If i = 1 Then

                If bWeekNumbers Then
                    .Left = lblWk.Left + lblWk.Width + BorderSpacing
                Else
                    .Left = BorderSpacing
                End If
            Else 'All other labels placed directly next to preceding label
                .Left = Me("lblDay" & CStr(i - 1)).Left + Me("lblDay" & CStr(i - 1)).Width
            End If
        End With
    Next i
    
    For i = 1 To 6 'Rows
        'First set position and visibility of week number label
        If Not bWeekNumbers Then
            Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Visible = False
        Else
            With Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i))
                .AutoSize = False
                .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
                .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
                .Left = BorderSpacing
                If i = 1 Then
                    .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + bgDayLabels.Height + (((bgDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize) - .Height) / 2)
                Else
                    .Top = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & "1").Top + Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & "1").Height + (((bgDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize) - .Height) / 2)
                End If
            End With
        End If
        
        For j = 1 To 7
            Set bgControl = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
            Set lblControl = Me("lblDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))

            With bgControl
                .Height = bgDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
                .Width = bgDateDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
                If j = 1 Then

                    If bWeekNumbers Then
                        .Left = Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Left + Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Width + BorderSpacing
                    Else
                        .Left = BorderSpacing
                    End If
                Else 'All other labels placed directly next to preceding label in row
                    .Left = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j - 1)).Left + Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j - 1)).Width
                End If
                If i = 1 Then
                    .Top = bgDayLabels.Top + bgDayLabels.Height
                Else
                    .Top = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & CStr(j)).Top + Me("bgDate" & CStr(i - 1) & CStr(j)).Height
                End If
            End With
            'Size and position actual date label
            With lblControl
                .AutoSize = False
                .Height = lblDateDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
                .Width = bgControl.Width
                .Left = bgControl.Left
                .Top = bgControl.Top + ((bgControl.Height - .Height) / 2)
            End With
        Next j
    Next i
    
    frameCalendar.Width = bgDate67.Left + bgDate67.Width + BorderSpacing

    If Me.InsideWidth < (frameCalendar.Left + frameCalendar.Width) Then
        Me.Width = Me.Width + ((frameCalendar.Left + frameCalendar.Width) - Me.InsideWidth)
    End If

    If Not OkayEnabled Then
        cmdOkay.Visible = False
        lblSelection.Visible = False
        lblSelectionDate.Visible = False
    Else

        With cmdOkay
            .Visible = True
            .Height = cmdButtonDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            If .Height > cmdButtonsMaxHeight Then .Height = cmdButtonsMaxHeight
            .Width = cmdButtonDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            If .Width > cmdButtonsMaxWidth Then .Width = cmdButtonsMaxWidth
            If SizeFont > cmdButtonsMaxFontSize Then
                .Font.Size = cmdButtonsMaxFontSize
            Else
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
            End If
            .Top = bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height + bgDayLabels.Height + BorderSpacing
        End With
        'The "Selection" label
        With lblSelection
            .Visible = True
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Width = frameCalendar.Width
            .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
            .AutoSize = True
            .Top = (bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height) + ((bgDayLabels.Height + BorderSpacing - .Height) / 2)
        End With
        'The actual selected date label
        With lblSelectionDate
            .Visible = True
            .AutoSize = False
            .Height = lblMonthYearDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            .Width = frameCalendar.Width - lblSelection.Width
            .Font.Size = HeaderDefaultFontSize * RatioToResize
            .Top = lblSelection.Top
        End With
    End If

    If Not TodayEnabled Then
        cmdToday.Visible = False
    Else
        With cmdToday
            .Visible = True
            .Height = cmdButtonDefaultHeight * RatioToResize
            If .Height > cmdButtonsMaxHeight Then .Height = cmdButtonsMaxHeight
            .Width = cmdButtonDefaultWidth * RatioToResize
            If .Width > cmdButtonsMaxWidth Then .Width = cmdButtonsMaxWidth
            If SizeFont > cmdButtonsMaxFontSize Then
                .Font.Size = cmdButtonsMaxFontSize
            Else
                .Font.Size = SizeFont
            End If
        End With
    End If
    
    If OkayEnabled And TodayEnabled Then 'Both buttons enabled.
        cmdToday.Top = cmdOkay.Top
        cmdButtonsCombinedWidth = cmdToday.Width + cmdOkay.Width
        cmdToday.Left = ((frameCalendar.Width - cmdButtonsCombinedWidth) / 2) - (BorderSpacing / 2)
        cmdOkay.Left = cmdToday.Left + cmdToday.Width + BorderSpacing
    ElseIf OkayEnabled Then 'Only Okay button enabled
        cmdOkay.Left = (frameCalendar.Width - cmdOkay.Width) / 2
    ElseIf TodayEnabled Then 'Only Today button enabled
        cmdToday.Top = bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height + BorderSpacing
        cmdToday.Left = (frameCalendar.Width - cmdToday.Width) / 2
    End If
    
    HeightOffset = Me.Height - Me.InsideHeight
    If OkayEnabled Then
        frameCalendar.Height = cmdOkay.Top + cmdOkay.Height + HeightOffset + BorderSpacing
    ElseIf TodayEnabled Then 'Only Today button enabled
        frameCalendar.Height = cmdToday.Top + cmdToday.Height + HeightOffset + BorderSpacing
    Else 'Neither button enabled
        frameCalendar.Height = bgDate61.Top + bgDate61.Height + HeightOffset + BorderSpacing
    End If
    
    If Me.InsideHeight < (frameCalendar.Top + frameCalendar.Height) Then
        Me.Height = Me.Height + ((frameCalendar.Top + frameCalendar.Height) - Me.InsideHeight - HeightOffset)
    End If
    
    If SelectedDate > 0 Then
        If SelectedDate < MinDate Then
            SelectedDate = MinDate
        ElseIf SelectedDate > MaxDate Then
            SelectedDate = MaxDate
        End If
        SelectedDateIn = SelectedDate
        SelectedYear = Year(SelectedDateIn)
        SelectedMonth = Month(SelectedDateIn)
        SelectedDay = Day(SelectedDateIn)
        Call SetSelectionLabel(SelectedDateIn)
    Else 'No SelectedDate provided, default to today's date
        cmdOkay.Enabled = False
        TempDate = Date
        If TempDate < MinDate Then
            TempDate = MinDate
        ElseIf TempDate > MaxDate Then
            TempDate = MaxDate
        End If
        SelectedYear = Year(TempDate)
        SelectedMonth = Month(TempDate)
        SelectedDay = 0 'Don't want to highlight a 'selected date,' since user supplied no date
        Call SetSelectionLabel(Empty)
    End If
    
    Call SetMonthCombobox(SelectedYear, SelectedMonth)
    scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
    cmbYearMin = SelectedYear - RangeOfYears
    cmbYearMax = SelectedYear + RangeOfYears
    If cmbYearMin < Year(MinDate) Then
        cmbYearMin = Year(MinDate)
    End If
    If cmbYearMax > Year(MaxDate) Then
        cmbYearMax = Year(MaxDate)
    End If
    For i = cmbYearMin To cmbYearMax
        cmbYear.AddItem i
    Next i
    cmbYear.value = SelectedYear
    
    'Set userform colors and effects
    Me.BackColor = BackgroundColor
    frameCalendar.BackColor = BackgroundColor
    bgHeader.BackColor = HeaderColor
    bgScrollCover.BackColor = HeaderColor
    lblMonth.ForeColor = HeaderFontColor
    lblYear.ForeColor = HeaderFontColor
    lblSelection.ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
    lblSelectionDate.ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
    bgDayLabels.BackColor = SubHeaderColor
    For i = 1 To 7
        Me("lblDay" & CStr(i)).ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
    Next i
    If bWeekNumbers Then
        lblWk.ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
        For i = 1 To 6
            Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).ForeColor = SubHeaderFontColor
        Next i
    End If
    For i = 1 To 6
        For j = 1 To 7
            With Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
                If DateBorder Then
                    .BorderStyle = fmBorderStyleSingle
                    .BorderColor = DateBorderColor
                End If
                .SpecialEffect = DateSpecialEffect
            End With
        Next j
    Next i
    
    TempDayOfWeek = StartWeek
    For i = 1 To 7
        Me("lblDay" & CStr(i)).Caption = Choose(TempDayOfWeek, "Su", "Mo", "Tu", "We", "Th", "Fr", "Sa")
        TempDayOfWeek = TempDayOfWeek + 1
        If TempDayOfWeek = 8 Then TempDayOfWeek = 1
    Next i
            
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
End Sub

Private Sub cmdOkay_Click()
    DateOut = SelectedDateIn
    Me.Hide
End Sub

Private Sub cmdToday_Click()
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date, if applicable
    Dim TodayDate As Date               'Today's date
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    SelectedDay = 0
    TodayDate = Date
    
    If OkayEnabled Then
        cmdOkay.Enabled = True
        SelectedDateIn = TodayDate
        Call SetSelectionLabel(TodayDate)
        SelectedDay = Day(TodayDate)
    End If
    
    SelectedMonth = Month(TodayDate)
    SelectedYear = Year(TodayDate)
    SelectedDay = GetSelectedDay(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
    
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub

Private Sub ClickControl(ctrl As MSForms.Control)
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date
    Dim SelectedDate As Date            'Date that the user has selected
    Dim RowIndex As Long                'Row index of the clicked date label
    Dim ColumnIndex As Long             'Column index of the clicked date label
    
    SelectedMonth = scrlMonth.value
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    
    RowIndex = CLng(Left(Right(ctrl.Name, 2), 1))
    ColumnIndex = CLng(Right(ctrl.Name, 1))
    SelectedDay = CLng(ctrl.Caption)
    
    If RowIndex = 1 And SelectedDay > 7 Then
        SelectedMonth = SelectedMonth - 1
        'Handle January
        If SelectedMonth = 0 Then
            SelectedYear = SelectedYear - 1
            SelectedMonth = 12
        End If
    
    ElseIf RowIndex >= 5 And SelectedDay < 20 Then
        SelectedMonth = SelectedMonth + 1
        'Handle December
        If SelectedMonth = 13 Then
            SelectedYear = SelectedYear + 1
            SelectedMonth = 1
        End If
    End If
    
    SelectedDate = DateSerial(SelectedYear, SelectedMonth, SelectedDay)
    
    If Not OkayEnabled Then
        DateOut = SelectedDate
        Me.Hide
    Else
        UserformEventsEnabled = False
            cmdOkay.Enabled = True
            SelectedDateIn = SelectedDate
            scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
            Call SetSelectionLabel(SelectedDate)
            Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
            Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
        UserformEventsEnabled = True
    End If
End Sub

Private Sub HoverControl(ctrl As MSForms.Control)
    If HoverControlName <> vbNullString Then
        Me.Controls(HoverControlName).BackColor = HoverControlColor
    End If
    HoverControlName = ctrl.Name
    HoverControlColor = ctrl.BackColor
    ctrl.BackColor = bgDateHoverColor
End Sub

Private Sub lblMonth_Click()
    cmbMonth.DropDown
End Sub
Private Sub lblYear_Click()
    cmbYear.DropDown
End Sub

Private Sub cmbMonth_Change()
    Call cmbMonthYearChange
End Sub
Private Sub cmbYear_Change()
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    Call SetMonthCombobox(cmbYear.value, scrlMonth.value)
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
    
    Call cmbMonthYearChange
End Sub

Private Sub cmbMonthYearChange()
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date
    
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    If SelectedYear = Year(MinDate) Then
        SelectedMonth = cmbMonth.ListIndex + Month(MinDate)
    Else
        SelectedMonth = cmbMonth.ListIndex + 1
    End If
    
    SelectedDay = GetSelectedDay(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    scrlMonth.value = SelectedMonth
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub

Private Sub scrlMonth_Change()
    Dim TempYear As Long        'Temporarily store selected year to test min and max dates
    Dim MinMonth As Long        'Sets lower limit of scroll bar
    Dim MaxMonth As Long        'Sets upper limit of scroll bar
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long   'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long    'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long     'Day of selected date
    
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
    
    MinMonth = 0
    MaxMonth = 13
    
    TempYear = cmbYear.value
    If TempYear = Year(MinDate) Then MinMonth = Month(MinDate)
    If TempYear = Year(MaxDate) Then MaxMonth = Month(MaxDate)
    
    If scrlMonth.value < MinMonth Then scrlMonth.value = scrlMonth.value + 1
    If scrlMonth.value > MaxMonth Then scrlMonth.value = scrlMonth.value - 1
    
    If scrlMonth.value = 0 Then
        scrlMonth.value = 12
        cmbYear.value = cmbYear.value - 1
        'If new year is outside range of combobox, add it to combobox
        If cmbYear.value < cmbYearMin Then
            cmbYear.AddItem cmbYear.value, 0
            cmbYearMin = cmbYear.value
        End If
        Call SetMonthCombobox(cmbYear.value, scrlMonth.value)

    ElseIf scrlMonth.value = 13 Then
        scrlMonth.value = 1
        cmbYear.value = cmbYear.value + 1

        If cmbYear.value > cmbYearMax Then
            cmbYear.AddItem cmbYear.value, cmbYear.ListCount
            cmbYearMax = cmbYear.value
        End If
        Call SetMonthCombobox(cmbYear.value, scrlMonth.value)
    End If
    
    SelectedMonth = scrlMonth.value
    SelectedYear = cmbYear.value
    SelectedDay = GetSelectedDay(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetMonthYear(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear)
    Call SetDays(SelectedMonth, SelectedYear, SelectedDay)
    
    UserformEventsEnabled = True
End Sub

Private Sub SetMonthCombobox(YearIn As Long, MonthIn As Long)
    Dim YearMinDate As Long             'Year of the minimum date
    Dim YearMaxDate As Long             'Year of the maximum date
    Dim MonthMinDate As Long            'Month of the minimum date
    Dim MonthMaxDate As Long            'Month of the maximum date
    Dim i As Long                       'Used for looping
    
    YearMinDate = Year(MinDate)
    YearMaxDate = Year(MaxDate)
    MonthMinDate = Month(MinDate)
    MonthMaxDate = Month(MaxDate)
    cmbMonth.Clear

    If YearIn = YearMinDate And YearIn = YearMaxDate Then
        For i = MonthMinDate To MonthMaxDate
            cmbMonth.AddItem Choose(i, "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        Next i
        If MonthIn < MonthMinDate Then MonthIn = MonthMinDate
        If MonthIn > MonthMaxDate Then MonthIn = MonthMaxDate
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - MonthMinDate
    
    ElseIf YearIn = YearMinDate Then
        For i = MonthMinDate To 12
            cmbMonth.AddItem Choose(i, "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        Next i
        If MonthIn < MonthMinDate Then MonthIn = MonthMinDate
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - MonthMinDate
    
    ElseIf YearIn = YearMaxDate Then
        For i = 1 To MonthMaxDate
            cmbMonth.AddItem Choose(i, "January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        Next i
        If MonthIn > MonthMaxDate Then MonthIn = MonthMaxDate
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1
    
    Else
        cmbMonth.List = Array("January", "February", "March", "April", "May", "June", "July", "August", "September", "October", "November", "December")
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1
    End If

End Sub

Private Sub SetMonthYear(MonthIn As Long, YearIn As Long)
    Dim ExtraSpace As Double                'Space between month and year labels
    Dim CombinedLabelWidth As Double        'Combined width of both month and year labels
    
    ExtraSpace = 4 * RatioToResize
    
    If YearIn = Year(MinDate) Then
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - Month(MinDate)
    Else
        cmbMonth.ListIndex = MonthIn - 1
    End If
    cmbYear.value = YearIn

    With lblMonth
        .AutoSize = False
        .Width = frameCalendar.Width
        .Caption = cmbMonth.value
        .AutoSize = True
    End With
    With lblYear
        .AutoSize = False
        .Width = frameCalendar.Width
        .Caption = cmbYear.value
        .AutoSize = True
    End With
    
    CombinedLabelWidth = lblMonth.Width + lblYear.Width
    With lblMonth
        .Left = ((frameCalendar.Width - CombinedLabelWidth) / 2) - (ExtraSpace / 2)
    End With
    With lblYear
        .Left = lblMonth.Left + lblMonth.Width + ExtraSpace
    End With

    cmbMonth.Left = lblMonth.Left - (cmbMonth.Width - lblMonth.Width) - ExtraSpace - 2
    cmbYear.Left = lblYear.Left

    HoverControlName = vbNullString
End Sub

Private Sub SetDays(MonthIn As Long, YearIn As Long, Optional DayIn As Long)
    Dim PrevMonth As Long               'Month preceding selected month. Used for trailing dates
    Dim NextMonth As Long               'Month following selected month. Used for trailing dates
    Dim Today As Date                   'Today's date
    Dim TodayDay As Long                'Day number of today's date
    Dim StartDayOfWeek  As Long         'Stores the weekday number of the first day in selected month
    Dim LastDayOfMonth As Long          'Last day of the month
    Dim LastDayOfPrevMonth As Long      'Last day of preceding month. Used for trailing dates
    Dim CurrentDay As Long              'Tracks current day in the month while setting labels
    Dim TempCurrentDay As Long          'Tracks the current day for previous month without incrementing actual CurrentDay
    Dim WeekNumber As Long              'Stores week number for week number labels
    Dim StartDayOfWeekDate As Date      'Stores first date in the week. Used to calculate week numbers
    Dim SaturdayIndex As Long           'Column index of Saturdays. Used to set color of Saturday labels, if applicable
    Dim SundayIndex As Long             'Column index of Sundays
    Dim MinDay As Long                  'Stores lower limit of days if minimum date falls in selected month
    Dim MaxDay As Long                  'Stores upper limit of days if maximum date falls in selected month
    Dim PrevMonthMinDay As Long         'Stores lower limit of days if minimum date falls in preceding month
    Dim NextMonthMaxDay As Long         'Stores upper limit of days if maximum date falls in next month
    Dim lblControl As MSForms.Control   'Stores current date label while changing settings
    Dim bgControl As MSForms.Control    'Stores current date label background while changing settings
    Dim i As Long                       'Used for looping
    Dim j As Long                       'Used for looping
    
    MinDay = 0
    MaxDay = 32
    If YearIn = Year(MinDate) And MonthIn = Month(MinDate) Then MinDay = Day(MinDate)
    If YearIn = Year(MaxDate) And MonthIn = Month(MaxDate) Then MaxDay = Day(MaxDate)

    PrevMonth = MonthIn - 1
    If PrevMonth = 0 Then PrevMonth = 12
    NextMonth = MonthIn + 1
    If NextMonth = 13 Then NextMonth = 1

    PrevMonthMinDay = 0
    NextMonthMaxDay = 32
    If YearIn = Year(MinDate) And PrevMonth = Month(MinDate) Then PrevMonthMinDay = Day(MinDate)
    If YearIn = Year(MaxDate) And NextMonth = Month(MaxDate) Then NextMonthMaxDay = Day(MaxDate)

    LastDayOfMonth = Day(DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn + 1, 0))
    LastDayOfPrevMonth = Day(DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, 0))
    StartDayOfWeek = Weekday(DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, 1), StartWeek)
    If StartWeek = 1 Then SundayIndex = 1 Else SundayIndex = 9 - StartWeek
    SaturdayIndex = 8 - StartWeek

    Today = Date
    If YearIn = Year(Today) And MonthIn = Month(Today) Then
        TodayDay = Day(Today)
    Else
        TodayDay = 0
    End If

    CurrentDay = 1
    For i = 1 To 6 'Rows

        If StartDayOfWeek = 1 And i = 1 Then

            TempCurrentDay = CLng(LastDayOfPrevMonth - (StartDayOfWeek + 5))
            If PrevMonth <> 12 Then
                StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, PrevMonth, TempCurrentDay)
            Else
                StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn - 1, PrevMonth, TempCurrentDay)
            End If
            
        ElseIf i = 1 Then
            StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, 1)
        
        Else
            If CurrentDay <= LastDayOfMonth Then
                TempCurrentDay = CurrentDay
                StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, MonthIn, TempCurrentDay)
           
            Else
                TempCurrentDay = CLng(CurrentDay - LastDayOfMonth)
                If NextMonth <> 1 Then
                    StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn, NextMonth, TempCurrentDay)
                Else
                    StartDayOfWeekDate = DateSerial(YearIn + 1, NextMonth, TempCurrentDay)
                End If
            End If
        End If
        WeekNumber = DatePart("ww", StartDayOfWeekDate, StartWeek, WeekOneOfYear)

        If WeekNumber > 52 And TempCurrentDay > 25 Then
            WeekNumber = DatePart("ww", DateSerial(YearIn + 1, 1, 1), StartWeek, WeekOneOfYear)
        End If
        Me("lblWeek" & CStr(i)).Caption = WeekNumber
        
        For j = 1 To 7 'Columns
            Set lblControl = Me("lblDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
            Set bgControl = Me("bgDate" & CStr(i) & CStr(j))
            With lblControl

                If StartDayOfWeek = 1 And i = 1 Then
                    'If minimum date is in current month, then previous month shouldn't be visible
                    If MinDay <> 0 Then
                        .Visible = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else
                        TempCurrentDay = CLng(LastDayOfPrevMonth - (StartDayOfWeek + 6 - j))
                        'Make sure previous month dates don't go beyond minimum date
                        If TempCurrentDay < PrevMonthMinDay Then
                            .Visible = False
                            bgControl.Visible = False
                        Else
                            .Visible = True
                            bgControl.Visible = True
                            .ForeColor = lblDatePrevMonthColor
                            .Caption = CStr(TempCurrentDay)
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If
                    
                ElseIf i = 1 And j < StartDayOfWeek Then
                    'If minimum date is in current month, then previous month shouldn't be visible
                    If MinDay <> 0 Then
                        .Visible = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else
                        TempCurrentDay = CLng(LastDayOfPrevMonth - (StartDayOfWeek - 1 - j))
                        'Make sure previous month dates don't go beyond minimum date
                        If TempCurrentDay < PrevMonthMinDay Then
                            .Visible = False
                            bgControl.Visible = False
                        Else
                            .Visible = True
                            .Enabled = True
                            bgControl.Visible = True
                            .ForeColor = lblDatePrevMonthColor
                            .Caption = CStr(TempCurrentDay)
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If

                ElseIf CurrentDay > LastDayOfMonth Then
                    If MaxDay <> 32 Then
                        .Visible = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else
                        TempCurrentDay = CLng(CurrentDay - LastDayOfMonth)
                        If TempCurrentDay > NextMonthMaxDay Then
                            .Visible = False
                            bgControl.Visible = False
                        Else
                            .Visible = True
                            .Enabled = True
                            bgControl.Visible = True
                            .ForeColor = lblDatePrevMonthColor
                            .Caption = CStr(TempCurrentDay)
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If
                    CurrentDay = CurrentDay + 1
                    
                Else
                    If CurrentDay < MinDay Or CurrentDay > MaxDay Then
                        .Visible = True
                        .Enabled = False
                        bgControl.Visible = False
                    Else 'Within bounds. Enable and set colors
                        .Visible = True
                        .Enabled = True
                        bgControl.Visible = True
                        'Set text color
                        If CurrentDay = TodayDay Then
                            .ForeColor = lblDateTodayColor
                        ElseIf j = SaturdayIndex Then
                            .ForeColor = lblDateSatColor
                        ElseIf j = SundayIndex Then
                            .ForeColor = lblDateSunColor
                        Else
                            .ForeColor = lblDateColor
                        End If
                        
                        'Set background color
                        If CurrentDay = DayIn Then
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateSelectedColor
                        Else
                            bgControl.BackColor = bgDateColor
                        End If
                    End If
                    .Caption = CStr(CurrentDay)
                    CurrentDay = CurrentDay + 1
                End If
            End With
        Next j
    Next i
End Sub

Private Sub SetSelectionLabel(DateIn As Date)
    Dim CombinedLabelWidth As Double        'Combined width of both labels, used to center
    Dim ExtraSpace As Double                'Space between the two labels
    
    ExtraSpace = 3 * RatioToResize

    If DateIn = 0 Then
        lblSelectionDate.Caption = vbNullString
        lblSelection.Left = frameCalendar.Left + ((frameCalendar.Width - lblSelection.Width) / 2)
    Else 'A selection has been made. Set caption and center
        With lblSelectionDate
            .AutoSize = False
            .Width = frameCalendar.Width
            .Caption = Format(DateIn, "mm/dd/yyyy")
            .AutoSize = True
        End With
    
        CombinedLabelWidth = lblSelection.Width + lblSelectionDate.Width
        lblSelection.Left = ((frameCalendar.Width - CombinedLabelWidth) / 2) - (ExtraSpace / 2)
        lblSelectionDate.Left = lblSelection.Left + lblSelection.Width + ExtraSpace
    End If
End Sub

Private Function GetSelectedDay(MonthIn As Long, YearIn As Long) As Long
    GetSelectedDay = 0
    
    'Check if a selected date was provided by the user
    If SelectedDateIn <> 0 Then
        If MonthIn = Month(SelectedDateIn) And YearIn = Year(SelectedDateIn) Then
            GetSelectedDay = Day(SelectedDateIn)
        End If
    End If
End Function

Private Function Min(ParamArray values() As Variant) As Variant
   Dim minValue As Variant
   Dim value As Variant
   minValue = values(0)
   For Each value In values
       If value < minValue Then minValue = value
   Next
   Min = minValue
End Function
Private Function Max(ParamArray values() As Variant) As Variant
   Dim maxValue As Variant
   Dim value As Variant
   maxValue = values(0)
   For Each value In values
       If value > maxValue Then maxValue = value
   Next
   Max = maxValue
End Function

```VBA
Private Sub cmbMonthYearChange()
    Dim SelectedMonth As Long           'Month of selected date
    Dim SelectedYear As Long            'Year of selected date
    Dim SelectedDay As Long             'Day of selected date
    
    If Not UserformEventsEnabled Then Exit Sub
    UserformEventsEnabled = False
```

Here's the VBA code that you can use to find the first empty row in column F, move down one row, and print the value "Last Twenty Jobs":

```
Sub FindFirstEmptyRow()

    Dim lastRow As Long
    
    ' Find the first empty row in column F
    lastRow = Cells(Rows.Count, "F").End(xlUp).Row + 1
    
    ' Move down one more row and print the value "Last Twenty Jobs"
    Cells(lastRow, "F").Value = "Last Twenty Jobs"

End Sub
```

You can run this code by clicking on the "Macros" button in the "Developer" tab in Excel, selecting the "FindFirstEmptyRow" macro, and clicking "Run".
